text: International Mutual Aid (IMA) is a Maryland 501(c)(3) registered nonprofit organization working to provide disaster and emergency medical assistance to underserved populations outside of the USA. International Mutual Aid was founded in November 2014 in response to the Ebola virus epidemic in West Africa. IMA deployed a medical team to Kono District, Sierra Leone in December 2014. This team remained in place for the duration of the Kono Ebola epidemic, coordinating with local resources to run a free primary care clinic, conduct Ebola surveillance, contact tracing, initial treatment for suspect Ebola cases, and provide public education. International Mutual Aid is engaged in Ebola recovery efforts in Kono, including the construction of a clean water project in Mofinko Section. ==See also== *Ebola virus epidemic in West Africa *Ebola virus epidemic in Sierra Leone *Ebola virus epidemic in Guinea *Ebola virus epidemic in Liberia *Ebola virus disease in Mali *Ebola virus disease *Health in Sierra Leone *List of Ebola patients ==References== ==External links== * International Mutual Aid Homepage Category:2014 establishments in Maryland Category:2014 establishments in Sierra Leone Category:Development charities based in the United States Category:African culture in Maryland Category:American companies established in 2014 Category:Charities based in Maryland Category:Health charities in the United States Category:Sierra Leonean-American history Category:Medical and health organizations based in Maryland Category:Foreign charities operating in Sierra Leone
title: International Mutual Aid
